32654678.review:
I feel really darn lame for downvoting and considering refunding this because I honestly really liked what I played. Late Shift is an FMV game, aka an occasionally interactive movie. Right off the bat, this won't be for everyone but I love these sorts of games!

Let's go over the good:
- Look great. The lighting is lovely, the video quality is fantastic and camera work is all fine.
- Acting is pretty good.
- Story is interesting
- Video clips are relatively seamless in their transitions from one another.
- Multiple endings

So what's the bad? Well, one somewhat minor issue is the audio mixing. The background noise is way too loud compared to dialogue and sometimes drowns it out, especially in the very first scene. There are subtitles so it's not too much of an issue but you cannot individually turn down dialogue and music to suit your needs - there's only one slider for overall audio, which I guess is fair considering how these video clips were probably made but still, you'd think someone would have noticed in production. 

Second thing is that you have very little time to answer some of the decisions, like literally a couple of seconds for a few choices. Sometimes during the game I would relax and not be able to make a choice because I wasn't expecting anything to pop up before it disappeared immediately. 

The third is the biggest and reason I'm considering a refund - there's no skip options for videos/scenes. This means, after completing one ending, I have to re-watch stuff I've already scene before and the amount is only going to increase with every play through. I don't think I can sit through that, my attention span is a lil poor. What if I get a bad ending or go down a bad path?  It'd be a lot easier to just look the game up on Youtube and watch a walkthrough where I've got more control over the video player.

So yeah, I don't know what I'm going to do here as I'm getting close to going over the refund period time.

32348693.review:
This is my second FMV game (my first was Contradiction: Spot the Liar!), and after having played it once, I am satisfied with my purchase and would buy it again.

The cinematography is excellent, the music is good, the acting is largely terrific, and the pacing is great. It's essentially like playing a crime thriller film; the video quality is sufficient enough for a theater-tier movie.

The game is somewhat brief, but I enjoyed the experience, and I am not sure that it would benefit from being longer, as I have read that there are several endings (I got a bad ending from my first playthrough).

This may be the only recent game I'll play a second time just to see how it changes when I make different choices.

I highly recommend this for anyone who enjoys FMV games, and if you have never played an FMV game before, I would recommend this as a place to start.

My only genuine complaint is that the music was a little too loud in sections and drowned out a few of the lines of dialogue mildly (the game does have subtitles, though), and there is no way to modify the music volume separately in the audio options.

I rate this game a 7.5/10, as far as FMV games are concerned.

32208774.review:
Сейчас очень популярно ругать любую игру, которая по мнению рецензента недостаточно "интерактивна" или типа того "кенцом". Если я правильно понял этот термин. Но здесь у нас, благодаря товарищам из Великобритании, где судя по всему всё ещё популярно такое явление как FMV (Full Motion Video), у нас есть реально кино в хорошем смысле и кино действительно интерактивное, где в определённые моменты мы решаем как пойдёт дальше сюжет. Конечно, попадаются порой и ложные выборы, которые не особо что-то меняют или не меняют ничего, но таких меньшинство, в основном сюжет будет меняться довольно кардинально. И только нам решать каким будет наш герой Мэтт: умником или болваном, гером или трусом, агрессивным забиякой, смиренным тихоней или коварным-расчётливым эгоистом. Концовок несколько и в принципе они разнообразны. У нас есть возможность заромансить (относительно) симпатичную азиатку, вырваться из лап китайской триады и разгадать хитрую аферу, попутно тем или иным способом наказав мошенника. Ну и поугарать может над тем как ГГ пытается сбежать от сюжета. Но слишком много про сюжет говорить не буду, чтобы не заспойлерить его лучше что называется прочувствовать и познать самим.

В отличии от Contradiction. Spot the Liar, тут как я понимаю, нет особо известных актёров, но все кто есть отыгрывает свои роли на отлично. Хех, после этой игры я понял, что точно ни зачто не пойду работать ночным сторожем. Что отдельно радует, у игры есть перевод субтитрами на русский официальный, не всегда точный, но толковый. А вот что не радует, так это то что в игре отсутствует функция, например, быстрой перемотки уже отсмотренных вами неинтерактивных сцен, так что времени она займёт много. Если всерьёз хотите пройти её на все ачивки и все концовки, приготовьтесь потратить несколько часов. И это ещё при условии, что всё будете делать правильно, а то знаете - зазеваетесь, не нажмете что-то в нужный момент или нажмете ни то - и всё, этого не переделать, никаких сейв-лоадов или обратной перемотки тут нет, придёться всю игру начинать заново, заново смотреть те же сцены. И без вариантов, так что будьте осторожнее. 

Тем ни менее игра стоит своих денег, я нисколько не пожалел, что потратился на неё, она доставила мне много удовольствия. Если любите FMV, интерактивное кино, криминальные драмы, британские сериалы и всё такое прочее (или хотя бы что-то из перечисленного), эта игра - для вас! 9 китайских рисовых чашек из 10. Снижение балла за отсутствие перемотки.

32173050.review:
I have mixed feelings about this one.

First of all, I have a great approval towards the idea of interactive movie genre (which also comes with high quality demands) since I've first played Fahrenheit long years ago. I like Late Shift for most of the feats movie should come with: good actor's play, tense narrative that doesn't give you any chance to feel bored (with lots of unexpected story turns), good camera work and nice soundtrack. I can't say I feel real depth in here, but it's first of all a triller, less a dramma. Events felt beliveable so I had my heart hammering lots of times.

Interactivity fits very good. You have less of it than in interactive movie games with 3D graphics of course, but choices are presented often enough to feel really involved, they are ambiguous and interesting. While the story branching is similar to one in Telltale games with more fake choices than real, there are unique scenes with different outcomes and illusion of player control holds still at least on first walkthrough. I'd really look towards industry develops more strong game design and fun in this direction. Because, as it is now, there are things that could be done better.

There are seven endings here which should be a plus, but for me they could be designed better. It's expected for this dangerous story to have lots of bad endings of course, but as they are rash and short and you have to replay each time from the beginning of the game with no skips or rewind options of any sort (yes, it's right, not impossible for 1.4h length story, but still a bummer), the endings feel like meh... Not rewarding.

On first play chances are high you won't get any likable ending, so if you will play again from the beginning 1.4h again you will of course see those fake choices I mentioned before and illusion will kinda break. Coupled with realization that story lack that deep that needs multiple walkthrough to grasp and feel again, from game design pespective Late Shift looks not really solid.

I believe this game will work only for those lads like me who are craving for interactive movie games and can't find enough qualitative enough on the market (from direction and story perspective). If you are not one of this lads, I'd recommend you to think twice before buying.

I will really hope next game-movie of this guys will be more polished in "game" sence not only in "movie" one.

32111187.review:
Late Shift is my first experience with an interactive FMV game and the experience was quite novel. It's particularly impressive how completely seemless the branching is. I've watched others play it twice and I've played it twice myself and it's equally true that there are very different experiences to be had with different groups of choices yet it does feel like some junctions are inevitable no matter what choices you make and to that extent, some choices feel a bit futile.

The most glaring flaw of this game is that you can't save your progress. If you make a choice that you want to change you have to start again from scratch and if you're near the end you'd better hope you rememebr all your previous choices that lead you to the one you want to change and you'd better be prepared to sit through the entire film in real time as you repeat all those choices until you come to the one you want to change. Because of this, it can be very frustrating as you try to explore the various endings and story chapters. I've found 3 endings so far and I'm not sure I can withstand the tedium of trying to find the other 4.

But despite that I wholeheartedly recommend anyone tries this game at least twice. Pro tip: Try to imagine and decide on a personality for the main character before you start and try to make decisions consistent with what that type of persom would do. That way your choices are less random and I think you get the greater reward.

32101677.review: I wasn't expecting much from Late Shift but as someone who loves decision based games I decided to give it a shot. Late Shift blew away my expectations. 所有结局大同小异。你可能会问为什么这么多好评？那是因为在同类型电影游戏里，这游戏的拍摄质量算上乘，但我玩过好多电影游戏了。这款游戏的剧情真的不优秀。你玩第一遍就了解了90%剧情。再玩一遍不仅没有快进和跳过，你得花上很多时间才能体验全部剧情，强行拖延游戏时间。

所以，不要轻易购买。你可以去视频网站看看某些up主的视频，他们通常不会全部剧透。如果你觉得剧情能接受的话，你再买。如果你也觉得这是一部烂片，就别费那个钱了。等你玩完几个结局感觉被骗之后，都不能退款了。

Спустя некоторое время решил переписать обзор, т.к. в старой версии я не до конца раскрыл свои мысли. 
Сюжет в этой игре безусловно на высоте. Сама игра сходит на короткометражку или даже на не очень полноценное кино. Но, разработчики решили порадовать игроков возможностью выбора и добавили концовки, хотя это больше напоминает насмешки по типу "Да, ты можешь сделать здесь выбор, но нам наср*ть на него, все-равно на концовку повлияет 1, ну максимум 2 выбора" 
Проблема этой игры в том, что ты как бы выбираешь какой либо путь, а как бы и нет... В этой игре где бы ты что не выбрал результат выбора вряд ли будет виден (максимум в концовке), но зачем игра предлагает сделать выбор когда он не на что не повлияет... 
Осталось показать спойлер из игры, как пример правильности моих слов - не один выбор до того как разобьется фургон никак не повлияет на дальнейшие развитие сюжета... Хорошо скажешь ты: "Там наверное есть сохранение на такой случай". И ты окажешься не прав...
В общем не рекомендую приобретать за полную стоимость.

32022660.review:
For an experience that sits on the edge of what a game is, Late Shift has managed to get me more invested than any other game in the last six months and probably the only one I've gone through multiple playthroughs of since Skyrim? *That I can remember*.

From an acting standpoint it is executed perfectly bar one slightly wobbly accent. *You will know it when you hear it* with a wide ranging cast you would expect in a well-funded Netflix tv series. This becomes more prevelant when you play a second or third time, as 'Matt' shows a wide spectrum of emotions usually seen over several series of a show. The fact I have never seen the actors beore helped as it didn't telegraph the main players in this slick but punctual story.

The flaws I have found are mostly in the technical department; some jittery transitions can cause the first second or two of a scene to be lost; taking you out of the moment as well as some inconsistancies with the subtitles. * I am one of those individuals that still reads subtitles even when audio is in my native language.*

The mechanics of the Late Shift only truly "broke" once when during a scene in a hospital *keeping it vague*, a piece of dialogue revealed a plot point only for the main character to remain ignorant to it until working the point out himself 20 seconds later.

These are small issues when compared to the enjoyment I had from my three playthroughs. I don't normally write reviews but one is deserved here even when written in a very generic way such as mine.

I have encouraged my housemate as well as close friends to sit down, switch off their phones and play this in silence as they will not be left wanting. With many different endings; some being nihilistic as all hell you are not spoilt for choice. Enjoy.

Ray.

*Edited as per Steam Award Nomination*

31986982.review:
Let me start out by saying I have never played an FMV before this game. Hell, I hadn't even heard of such a thing. But this game is certainly something worth trying. I have played a LOT of choice-based games, but the choices in this one had consequences that were honestly hard to predict. The acting is pretty solid, but what stood out the most for me, were the number of choices you would be given in many scenarios. Instead of the "do it" and "don't do it" options that plague most of this genre, this game is much more versatile. 

Okay, the game does have some of those, but more than half of the choices you are given have at least 3 options, and many of them have 4. The game has in total, 7 endings, and each ending takes an hour to get (except for one which is an hour and a half) so expect to get about 10 hours out of this.

Finally, if you would rather see the game for yourself, I have uploaded a no commentary playthrough on my youtube channel to help you more effectively gauge what you are buying.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5n9nkzXEktg&t=1448s

31986503.review: 如果你是WIn98时代开始玩游戏的话，对 FMV 绝对不会生疏，因为《太空女妖》等R级VCD、DVD视频游戏已经深入你的习惯，这个可以算是一股清流。如果你玩过蓝光的《死神来了》，那这个游戏可能就入不了你法眼了，毕竟这个不是什么大制作。比较STEAM上所有同类游戏，这个突出之处是无缝的即时选择和小成本但很良心的视频拍摄，不足之处在于剧本生硬，重复太多而无法跳过，强迫某一主线发展。可以这么说，前半段的叙事与选择都是打酱油充数的，真正重要的部分完全就是被抓住后才出现。真正的分支太少，当然考虑到售价，也算值回票价。事实上这也是我国低成本网剧的一条新出路了！

On joue le rôle de Matt un étudiant qui arrondit ces fins de mois mais aussi pour financer ces études en réalisant un petit job de gardien dans un parking  avec de très belles voitures, mais cette soirée ne va pas se passer comme prévu suite à  une demande  un peu particulière d’une jeune femme blonde..

Un jeu qui fait le job il  réconciliera  le Genre Fmv avec les gamers, je le recommande pour les fans de Life is strange  et /ou des jeux telltales à petit prix  ou dans un bundle ;). Je suivrai  avec  plaisir les prochaines productions de ctrlmovie


Quelques Plus  :

31981123.review:
[h1]恨得牙痒痒，还是颤抖地点了“好评”[/h1]

[b]※ 先上自制攻略 ※[/b]
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=933007601
[b]※ 再说为什么恨 ※[/b]
GTX970M，进程反复卡死、崩溃、无法启动……况且[b]章节中间没有存档点[/b]，一旦出问题只能整章重玩。不时卡帧吓吓你，搞得一有异响就心惊肉跳。讨论区不少N卡玩家都汇报了类似情况，亲测唯一有效的办法：在GeForce Experience下，点选“设置”→取消分享。[strike]成功从每十分钟崩溃三次下降到每周目崩溃一次[/strike]。其它诸如升级解码包什么的办法就算了，纯粹心理安慰。更新似乎也没能完全解决这个问题。

[b]※ 我为什么还是成为了一名抖M ※[/b]
太长不看请跳到最后结论。

（1）[i]制作完成度高。[/i]本作的创意不算新鲜，然而节奏酣畅、悬念迭起，前半程处处伏笔，上百个大小抉择扑朔迷离，七大结局无论走向如何，剧情基本都能给圆上。全员演技在线，不乏亮眼表现。更新后，BGM音量更平衡，原本音乐盖过台词的毛病得到了改善。对比内容充实度和价格，着实良心。

（2）[i]游戏设计好。[/i]是的，你没看错，我夸了《晚班》的游戏性。《亲爱的艾斯特》制作人Dan Pinchbeck说过，把游戏性和故事割裂开，是一种常见的认知误区。[b]故事本身，也是游戏性的一种。[/b]游戏的本质是什么？利用界面环境中的一切提示，执行操作，根据所获得的反馈，对操作加以修正或改进。那么，依据声音画面交代出的故事线索，观察、推理、判断、选择、循环——这一过程完全符合游戏的定义，没毛病。为什么说《晚班》这方面做得不错？
[list]    [*][i]它的反馈是及时的。[/i]再小的选择支都会带来有意义的剧情。
    [*][i]它是公平的。[/i]作为剧情类游戏的容错率，很多地方一次选完见势不妙，玩家会得到补救选择的机会，也就是上面所说的能够“根据所获得的反馈，对操作加以修正或改进”。
    [*][i]它没有神逻辑。[/i]虽然不能说完全没有漏洞，但什么行为导致什么结果，上下一缕大致都能找到来龙去脉。

    以及
    [*]不能因为通篇QTE，就否认其游戏性。复杂的按键组合≠游戏性好。简单的游戏机制≠坏机制。有效的就是好的。如何在不靠攻略，只凭察言观色、听话解意的情况下，首次就达成完美结局？这就是这类游戏所磨炼的一套技巧，它或许跟动作类策略类所需要的技巧不同，但也是技巧。而且在《晚班》反馈及时、公平、不神逻辑的机制下，[b]这是完全、完全可以做到的[/b]。
    [*]对游戏性的认知越包容，就越有利于产生让人惊喜的新品种。跨界融合，既代表叙事的未来，也会不断拓展游戏的疆界。这对任何形态的娱乐产品来说都是好事。本作虽然没达到那个高度，但它代表的方向完全无可指摘。[/list]

（3）[i]然后，我认为无法快进算不上什么缺点。[/i]我知道这个观点很惹争议，但是[b]剧情类游戏快进剧情，和动作类游戏战斗全自动化有什么区别？[/b]这恰恰是剥夺了该类型最大的乐趣。觉得情节不够吸引自己多周目，又放不下好奇心？视频攻略随手一搜就有。有些人愿意为了“用火焰陷阱困住200个敌人”这种成就重复打上几十上百小时，相比之下，我并不觉得本作的成就条件有多不近人情。如果怕腻味，放置一段时间，等记忆淡忘再重新捡起来好了。这年头大家耐心都差，但既不愿意投入相应的时间精力，又恨不得一刷就全成就，只能说潜意识里还是看不起这类游戏而已。增加快进选项当然没有不好，但[b]要不要为扩大受众而做出妥协，是制作者的选择，不构成对错问题。[/b]

[b]※ 结论快速通道 ※[/b]
A. 高度匹配人群
[list]
    [*]好奇心旺盛的故事党
    [*]细水长流慢慢来的细节控[/list]
B. 怒删高危人群
[list]
    [*]快速全成就党
    [*]受诅咒的N卡玩家[/list]
C. 打折宜入人群
[list]
    [*]光视频通关不满足的手痒党
    [*]没有全成就强迫症的尝鲜党
[/list]

31968280.review:
不错的FMV（Full Motion Video），这是传统意义上的交互电影表现形式（专门区别于Qunatic Dream的《暴雨》、《超凡双生》或者DONOTNOD的《Life is Strange》这种全动作捕捉、实时渲染、全配音的新型交互电影形式），通过完整的真人拍摄电影，通过不同的选择来衔接起来整个故事。而且不同选项之间衔接非常（提前选择，时间过了就会选择默认行为，这里就就要批评一些FMV那种让故事暂停来等待玩家选择的表现方式）。整体故事比较有意思，男主的演技也非常出色，尤其是面部表现，无论是警匪片的紧张感，动作场面都属于上乘。结局的意外性也算不错。

关于交互性，也可以看其他人介绍，实际上确实主要影响的就是最后的帕尔家的选择，大部分的玩家都可以选到完美结局，前面的一些细节选项不会影响大走势，但是对人物的理解会更丰富一些。

总体来说比较满意，整个结局流程时间在1小时半左右，但是交互性比较强，代入感也比较赞。现在还出了官方中文，喜欢交互电影形式的玩家非常推荐。

This isn't the sort of game I would normally play, not sure why just nevre really appealed to me I guess.  I played a couple of similar type games recently but it was Late Shift that I was really looking forward to, I'd seen the game trailer, and it looked good.

But looks can be deceiving, it doesn't look good, it looks great.  The video is high quality, you feel like you are in those dark late night streets of London, or one of the many other locations the game takes part, and are drawn in not just by the look of Late Shift but by the story itself.

I have so farr only found two of the endings so far, but intend of trying to complete this.  I do really like Late Shift, maybe more than I expeced and would hope for more in this vein from the developer.  My only concern was it was a little short but then for the price I suppose that's a mute point as you certainly get your money's worth and it has replayability.

Would recommend Late Shift for those into these type of games but also for those looking for something a little different from the normal type of game.

31927373.review:
[H1]Well *this* escalated quickly...[/H1]

Matt settles in for another boring night of reading algabraeic game theory (irony, that's a subject I touched on in my academic studies), and before he's even had a chance to skive off for the first nightly trip to the loo he's stuffed into a Maserati at gunpoint and enrolled into a high stakes heist to rob a very small piece of very expensive porcelain from a very powerful and dangerous chinese family.

And you thought this game was going to be about a Late Shift as a car park attendant. YOU FOOL.

[H1]It's not like the old Laserdisc games like Dragon's Lair, here your choices matter![/H1]

The game is something between a full on movie and a VN, where the choices occur as the reel rolls in real time, this means every decision has a very definitive time constraint, and every option is going to leave you with a very definite sense of "Cost benefit" analysis as you move through the film. Some of the choices are very throwaway, with only minimal impact on the storyline, others have some impact, leaving imprints on how things play out (a specific point at the end neatly bookends a choice at the beginning). Others will cause the storyline to go veering off wildly into different directions, some of them highly unpleasant.

[H1]Get the thick gloves on chaps, this is about to get bloody...[/H1]

Broadly speaking this is -not- a kid friendly film, at all, the whole thing can turn very grim in the late stages, with a bit of torture, some violence and a peppering of coarse language but it's used well, and the actors to their credit all play their parts at least competently, with standout performances going to Parr, Woe, Mei-Ling and Matt, each playing their respective parts absolutely pitch perfect at the respective points that you actually get to encounter Woe and Parr properly.

[H1]Final thoughts[/H1]

Suffice to say, your choices shape what Matt becomes, and how he behaves, he can try to undermine things and play the part of the "good guy", or he can dive in and become a part of what's going on around him. The game handles the process with exceptional ease, and despite the runtime being around 50 or so minutes, this is a high quality 50 minutes you get to spend in the company of these characters. Whilst it may not stand up to many many repeat playthroughs (indeed, seven endings, and a bunch of them revolve around what happens down one specific branch), the first playthrough alone will leave you thoughtful. That's worth the entry fee.

[b]Verdict:[/b] A movie that is also a game, and it's -good-. If this appeals, buy the hell out of it. I found it highly worth the time.

31908281.review:
[h1] Хороший курс задали разработчики, но немного не туда [/h1]

Многие данный проект и игрой не назовут, но я считаю зря. Авторы решили продолжить тенденцию с The Bunker, но немного в другом ключе. Бункер - это более цельный проект, нежели Лэйт Шифт. Здесь вам дают право создать свою историю, но вновь вспоминая Бункер, ваша история может быть сыграна 7 раз и всегда по разному. С одной стороны, я всегда люблю вариативность в играх и право создавать такое - это очень круто. Смотря многие фильмы, такого там действительно не хватает, ведь всегда хочется приложить свою руку к чему-то интересному. Но стоит сказать и про другую сторону. 7 различных концовок и различные выборы - это интересно, но только на половину, потому что дальше придется терпеть одно и то же, чтобы дойти до ключевых моментов. В общем, тут все неоднозначно. 

Я не могу сказать, что сюжет здесь хороший, он такой.. средний. Я не могу сказать, что интересно пересматривать все до 7 концовки и даже не слишком возникает желание до нее дойти. Актеры, особенно подчеркивая главного, вполне неплохи, но не дотягивают даже до персонажа Бункера. Мне очень нравится смотреть фильмы и играть в текстовые квесты, а здесь это еще и реализовано в одном едином. Если бы разработчик пошел на серьезную картину хотя бы на 5 часов и с 2-3 концовками - это было бы идеально. 

Итого: данный жанр заслуживает развития, но понятное дело не все игры должны быть такими. Надеюсь, что дальнейшие проекты будут только набирать обороты и подвинут TellTale с их интерактивным "кинцом" 

А пока что 7/10

31853072.review:
This FMV choose your own adventure that takes about an hour for each play through. Unlike most FMV games, it has a completely seamless flow. Scenes are stitch together without any harsh cuts and it seems like the soundtrack is dynamically mixed to maintain continuity across all the branching paths and timing of your decisions. Also the acting, cinematography, and music are all very well done.

Choices are fairly frequent and, while you have a time limit to decide, there aren't quick time events. Sometime choices only make a minor difference and others take the story to completely new locations. I've played twice and while some events are inevitable, I encountered several new characters and scenarios. Quick example, my first playthrough I was arrested, kidnapped, interrogated someone at a hospital, and snuck into a facility, but none of that in my second playthrough and instead I tracked down a crime boss, fled from a gang, and took a lady to a motel.

There's things I'd like to try in a third playthrough, but without a fast forward or chapter select feature I think I would be repeating too much material. I really hope they add this as a "New Game+" type feature. Another minor gripe is that there's no meta plot that ties multiple viewings together (something like Nobody Has To Die or Zero Escape). The plot itself has some subtext about choices, but it doesn't go much deeper.

31671619.review:
You may or may not recall that during the early to mid 90s, FMV gaming became a thing.  Games like Night Trap pioneered the genre.  Personally, my first experience with an FMV game happened in 1996 with a game called Star Trek Borg.  That game also marketed itself as an interactive movie.  For the most part, it was interactive, but the choices you could make were rigid.  You didn't have a lot of room for exploration.

With Late Shift, that is not the case.  As of this review, I've reached 4 out of a possible 7 endings.  For the first part of the game, your options are somewhat rigid, but once you get deeper into the game, your choices become numerous.

For the most part, I enjoyed this game.  It was a nice callback to my earlier days, but there was one thing that kind of irked me.  As I previously stated, there are numerous endings to this game.  As such, you'd probably want to play through it a few times to see what happens.  There's an introduction scene that runs about 2 minutes or so.  I haven't timed it exactly, but you have to sit through it every time you want to play.  It would have been nice if there was an option to skip the opening scene after you've already reached one of the endings.

With that said, I would recommend this game to fans of the FMV genre.

        生活中我们有着各种各样的抉择，一些让我们备感惊喜，另一些则让我们追悔莫及，男主作为一个夜班保安（还是叫车库看守什么的），每天过着重复而沉闷的生活，看着无聊的小说，就像现实中的许多人一样；突如其来的变故让他觉得危险的同时又是那么刺激，每每可以揭发这些人的恶行的时刻，男主都选择了帮助他们，进而加入他们，直到发现被幕后指使所欺骗，成功揭发真相，保全了自己和心爱的女人。

终于可以在电影里玩游戏了！

交互式电影体验，是这个游戏最大的价值，很好，它做的不错。或许会觉得它流程太短，单次通关也就1小时左右，但至少它提供了一个完整的流程，和还行的好莱坞的故事。

一开始想将它分类到AVG，但是细想，很明显游戏里面所有的选择更像是QTE而不是传统意义AVG里面的主观动作。游戏里，你没法调查、没法拾取、更没法存档（一个小时通关还要啥存档），你所做的就是代入男主，做出选择，决定自己的命运。所以用真人拍摄的形式，紧张的冒险故事，最大程度保证了代入感。3D目前再精美，还是会让人觉得是在玩游戏，似乎现在只有真人才能刺激到玩家了？！不过这样的代价就是太耗时啦，想想7个结局，虽然通关只要一小时，但是整个拍摄制作绝对不会小于一部正规电影的耗时。

从2D动画风（极速天龙重置了！）到3D（近期我就想起奇异人生），再经过现在的Late Shift，我想下一个怎么着也要该VR发挥了吧。

其实，橙光很多游戏也可以仿这个游戏的样式来升级嘛哈。

31569722.review:
This is a movie/VN hybrid, where choices for once actually do matter and makes a huge difference in what you see.  The production values, acting and story are all excellent (and I never say that about acting or voice overs in a game).  This is set in London, with British actors so expect local accents (but you can play with subtitles on) gritty and parental advisory - adult language (lots of "f" words even one "c" word in one of the routes).

If you are expecting a more interactive adventure game like contradiction or missing then you might be a little disappointed.  There is no interaction with environment, or examining things.  All interaction including any choice in where you want to go, is in the form of words on the screen where you have to be quick to make your choice.  But because of the quality of everything and the many different routes you can take, I just appreciated it for what it was, and wished other FMVs games were of this quality throughout.

The one negative I will say is for achievement hunters, there are 7 different endings but some of these are different choice at very end of game so replaying the entire game 7 times gets tiring quick.  If there was a way to skip scenes you had seen before this would be good but sadly you can't. 

 I did find a workaround (sort of) at the end when you get an ending achievement, exit the game immediately.  Upon relaunch you will be taken back about 5 mins as it hasn't synched up yet.   This way you only need to replay the entire game once more, maybe twice, which you would want to do anyway to see the different routes.  The only thing is you don't get to see your ending but I found good youtube videos which you can watch the last 2-5mins of each one, to see what you missed.  Just putting the thought out there, in case you were put off with replaying an entire game so many times.

There are 2 major different routes you can take with many more minor changes in most of the other scenes, it really was impressive how they did it and how it all came together.  If you don't mind the style of game, more of an interactive movie then I do recommend it.  I love FMV, adventure games and real choices matter VNs so even though it was different to what I expected I thought it was very good.

31569535.review:
Dieses Spiel ist jeden Cent wert! Und wenn man bedenkt, dass der Preis nicht höher als der einer DVD ist, sollte jeder, der auf Spiele mit Entscheidungen, einer guten Geschichte und dem Drang, in ein Spiel eintauchen zu wollen, dieses Spiel in Betracht ziehen!
Ich habe das Spiel zweimal mit komplett unterschiedlichen Entscheidungen durchgespielt - und es ergaben sich tatsächlich auch zwei sehr unterschiedliche Storylines!
Ja, einige Szenen sind gleich und machen je nach voriger Entscheidung mehr oder weniger Sinn, aber ich denke, das ist absolut tolerierbar. Und ja, in der deutschen Übersetzung stimmt nicht immer überein, was man gewählt hat, und was dann ausgeführt wurde (bisher dreimal bei mir).
Aber was dieses Spiel leistet, ist einfach großartig. Die Entscheidungen, die du triffst, haben bedeutende Auswirkungen (nicht wie in Telltale-Spielen) auf den Storyverlauf. 
Was die Optik dieses Spieles betrifft kann ich nur sagen, dass Darsteller, Inszenierung und Style wikrlich gut sind. Die Akustik ist manchmal zu laut auf der (genialen) Musikseite, so dass die Stimmen kaum zu verstehen sind. Der (cool walisiche) britische Akzent wird einigen 'Amerikanern' Schwierigkeiten bereiten, aber die deutschen Untertitel sind auf den Punkt, also egal...
Kann es kaum erwarten, weitere Entscheidungen zu revidivieren und in die Feinheiten zu gehen. Schade nur, dass es keine Savepoints gibt. Alles immer komplett durchzuspielen mindert den Enthusiasmus, alle Varianten durchzuspielen...

31489532.review:
LATE SHIFT is a FMV, a genre that's still improving and one that I'm always looking forward to playing and experiencing. This game is no different, and being crime thriller makes it that more exciting and interesting. LATE SHIFT is a game where your choices truly matter carving a unique and thrilling journey albeit sometimes falling through cracks of its own ambitions. 

[b]Pros[/b]

*Great acting all around with few bad apples here and there should leave you more than satisfied at the end of the adventure
*Solid storyline(s)
*Great replayability value - this game offers 7 unique endings, 14 different chapters that you can explore and great replay value. Each playthrough will offer different dialogue and storyline to follow.
*Charming characters and actors that (in most cases) do justice to their respective role
*Great price for what it offers

[b]Cons[/b]

*Some of the actors aren't up to bar, but given the price, these are easily overlooked
*Story inconsistencies will sometimes leave a bad taste in your mouth


[b]Story[/b]

In LATE SHIFT, you play Matt, a college student that works at a parking lot with many expensive and fancy cars to look over. After the car gets stolen in a place you work, you are dragged into a brutal London heist with not many options but to follow their words and do as you told. Shaping your own path with choices that you make, the story will lead you to one of seven different conclusions. The story is nothing spectacular or revolutionary, but the replayability and different paths that you take will offer different experiences every time. 

[b]Gameplay & Graphics[/b]

Being a FMV, LATE SHIFT offers nothing radical in its department as their focus is on telling a great story.


[b]Is this game ProperValue for your money?[/b]

For its price, and replayability it offers with solid actors and shape all around, this game offers great value even at a full cost. I'd recommend this to anyone that is looking for a good FMV game as it offers fantastic experience throughout the whole journey.

If you liked this review, please consider subscribing to our curator page here: 
http://steamcommunity.com/groups/ProperV#curation

31387013.review:
Overall, great movie but even the best movie in the world will become annoying after watching it 5, 6 times.

Be aware that this game has [b] NO [/b] skip, fast forward, save, chapter selection or any other feature that may help you avoid watching repeated scenes over and over again.

If you want to get the different endings of the game, you just have to watch everything repeatedly. The experience becomes increasingly unbearable as the number of repetition increased. By the time you try to get your sixth ending, 90% of the content will be something you already watched before.

For people who are really interested in the story, I highly recommend you to watch the walkthroughs on YouTube instead and buy the game just to support the developers. Btw, I do consider the story to be pretty decent, despite some flaws. 

<Spoilers Alert>

These flaws are pretty minor and do not have a huge impact on the overall storyline. I just thought it might be interesting to point them out.

[spoiler] In what universe would someone not call the police after being almost kidnapped/killed? Seriously, the girl just goes to take an extra shift in the hospital like she just doesn't care. If you have no idea about what I'm refering to here, try giving the girl the car keys. [/spoiler]

[spoiler] If you decide to take the bowl to the police, a police interrogation will take place. During the police interrogation,  Matt was asked to prove that he has been forced to participate in this crime. The only two options there was either no or mention May-Ling. I find this funny, because the parkinglot he works at obviously have cameras. You could assume that any record is most likely erased, but that is no reason for not mentioning it to the police at all. If you choose to give those keys to the girl, you also have that girl as an eye witness. Despite those much better evidences exist, Matt still decides that the only two options are saying he has no evidence at all or mention someone from the group of criminals who forced him. [/spoiler]

31381759.review:
3 часа. 2 концовки. 14 глав. 57 выборов. Думаю стоит и еще по тухнуть за монитором да бы понять как можно получить выгоду из всей той передряги в которую влипает наш ГГ-студен, охраняющий по ночам довольно таки солидную парковку с мазерати и весьма не дешевой моделью бмв и т.д.,

[h1]О сюжете на первые 5 минут	[/h1] 

[spoiler] И так как уже говорил выше студент-охранник, очередная ночь, пару толстых кошельков на солидных машинах и толстый учебник из разряда физ-мата. Пока ГГ любовался БМВ, а точнее грел сиденье, вернулся один из толстых кошельков, с миловидной блонди, который в надменной форме оставил его без чаевых. Что ж "босс"-придурок. С грустью усевшись на рабочем месте, ГГ пытается впитать знания, как вдруг спускается к нему на парковку та самая миловидная блонди и кокетливо уламывает паренька дать ключики от мазерати но... ни кто не должен знать. А что сделаете вы? Отдадите ключи без вопросов? С сомнением скажите зачем? Или вы отвлечетесь на камеру наблюдения? Ведь пока вы беседовали вы услышали пронзительный грохот упавшего металла.	[/spoiler]

[h1] Картина в целом[/h1]

Из описания вы знаете, что будет ограбление, но не стоит ждать чего-то в стиле Крепкого орешка или Джеймса Бонда припудренного спецэффектами. Классика вот что лучше всего - бизнес-костюм, наручники, пара шприцов с химией, подельники и красавица (на вкус и цвет). Ах да! Ну и, конечно же, план, который вы узнаете только на ходу. 

Что сказать о заднем ракурсе... он так же красив и натурален, но я бы сказал, что его не хватает (на этом просто не акцентируются, в основном действия в комнатах, машинах, парковках -_-)
 
Звуковое сопровождение не навязывается, когда надо вы его услышите, когда нет, вы забудете что оно есть и это вам не помешает наслаждаться сюжетом.

Сюжет мне понравился. Вариативность? Хорошая, но пока открыл 2/7 концовок. 

Слишком уж все хорошо складывается да по моему скромному резюме? 
Есть один минус, много концовок-нет сохранений(только чекпойнты которые никак не обозначаются), что ж нас ждут долгие "химические" эксперименты с выбором да бы добиться всех концовок, узнать все что нас ждет/ждало.
Любителям нелинейности...  за такой ценник (289RUB) рекомендовано к приобретению.

31380712.review:
Pretty enjoyable interactive movie-- and it is definitely more "movie" than "game"-- with excellent production values. Set and costume design, cinematography, soundtrack and acting are all generally solid. The only technical glitches were in a few choice points where the last half-second of a line of dialogue was cut as the engine lined up the next shot/scene.

Anyone who's played The Walking Dead or any other Telltale game will recognize the pattern: lots of decisions both big and small, the majority of which probably don't have much gameplay impact beyond the immediate interaction, if that. To me, though, these moments still matter because they help to build up my own understanding of my character. It felt a lot more immersive to realize that my character was getting better and better at taking risks as he got used to his shocking new circumstances, but still chickened out when the pressure was really on. And I regret that I didn't [spoiler]return May's kiss when I had the chance, for fear of taking advantage of her distress at that moment after escaping the henchmen[/spoiler]. In the end, I don't think she would have minded.

I've only unlocked 1 of 7 endings so far, and it wasn't a happy one, so I'll certainly try again-- after a while. Even though one playthrough only takes about an hour and a half, it's no fun mashing through multiple permutations in a row with this sort of game... spoils my engagement with the character.

31331960.review: Late Shift has got to be one of the best games I have ever purchased. I'm a big fan of the system where your choices matter and Late Shift nearly perfects it. 31331578.review:
This is a very interesting game and a great alternative to watching a movie. The game promises 7 different endings based on your choices. Far too many of these choices are pretty pointless and it makes you wonder why you are wasting your time deciding between 2 or 3 things if it literally has no impact on anything, no impact on the ending, heck, not even an impact on how the story leads up to that ending nor how the story gets concluded.

Far too many endings are the same outcome for you, or in other words, your character Matt. Like, at least 2 endings are literally the exact same endings, they just happen at different locations. I just flat out gave up and looked up the endings of YouTube cos there is no way you can go back 1 step and take another choice, no, you literally have to go through the entire movie again, which is very annoying if you just wanted to see the different ending but don't want to spend another hour playing the entire movie back again, having to remember all of your choices. This is very annoying, imagine a shooting game that is very long and if you die just once, you have to go back and play through all of the levels again. That is exactly what this movie does wrong.

Moreover, the voices are nearly inaudible when playing with music. (Thanks subtitles).

This is in overall a bad game with too many promises. I was expecting a game where every choice I made had impact to 7 vastly different endings, not just that 2 endings are the exact same, just that they take place in different locations.

I can't recommend buying this game when you can literally watch playthroughs of all the 7 different endings on YouTube.

Just don't waste your 10-15 Euros on this one, it's simply not worth playing through the entire thing 7 times for 6 very similar endings and 1 different ending, it's simply not worth it. Heck, you may have to play it through 15 times cos the chance you are gonna make choices with no impact are big.

Anyways, I do recommend it if you plan to just play it through once as a one time movie, but I doubt that's the case, therefore, from a general perspective, I can't recommend buying this game.

31316850.review: Late Shift is decent. It's a lot like a TellTale game. There's lots of minor decisions to make and a small handful of decisions that actually change the course of the game. There's no game play in Late Shift. You're given a prompt for how the main character should act/respond and the video just skips to what choice you made each time. This could probably be played with just a Blu-ray player and the remote. There's around 40-60 choices for each play through. The story itself is just ok. It's on par with the indie films you've never heard of that video game sites, including Steam, having been selling for a few years now. It was fun to play through scenarios again and see how they changed with different choices. There are different endings, but most of them are derivatives of the same thing. The way the game is setup to accommodate variations that come with different choices leaves the whole story coming across as especially unbelievable. The whole situation with Mr. Woe seems really confusing and any part of the plot even tangentially related seems like a plot hole. The plot overall makes sense, but individual scenes come across as highly unrealistic. At least the acting is pretty decent overall and the characters with the most screen time are interesting. The main chick is by far the most compelling character in the story. She's fun to look at and steals every scene she's in. There was a problem with the audio. The music was way louder than the dialogue. The subtitles were mandatory as the music drowns out the dialogue. There's no way to adjust the voice and music sound independently, either. Overall, I think it's decent enough to recommend if you enjoy repeat play throughs to see how things change each time. Late Shift isn't great by any means, but I enjoyed my time with it.

刚刚解锁了一个 bad end 结局。我真是不适合犯案，第一次只活到第 9 章。
随便估计一下，true end 大概也就是个极其普通的爆米花电影，从电影院看完回家就能忘掉主角名字的那种。一个不起眼的 nobody 阴差阳错被卷入某个犯罪事件，然后一路上解决各种麻烦，查明了某种真相 / 得到了某件宝物 / 完成了某个目标……
这类的套路电影已经很难给人新奇感和紧张感了，因为大家都知道有「主角光环」这回事。只要是主角，不管设定上多么一无所长、身处的环境多么险恶、做的决定多么糟糕，总是能逢凶化吉，要死也要到最后时刻。
互动电影就不一样了，一系列愚蠢的决定累积在一起真的能让主角死掉，让主角倒霉。实际上总共的结局有七种，大概有六种都不是善终。拿掉了「主角光环」，nobody 终于有了点 nobody 的样子了。
不过仔细想想，以往的 avg 很多不就是这种的吗？为什么我会觉得 Late Shift 比较特别呢？大概是实在太像电影了，参考、对比起来更多用的是看电影的经验。

不过 Late Shift 作为游戏有个很大的问题，这是二周目不能快进吗？那想看到所有结局，重复的片段要看多少遍？！也太不合理了。

31308051.review:
[h1] Late Shift	[/h1]

Merhaba Türk Dostlar,

Oyunumuz "Late Shift" , CtrlMovie tarafından geliştirilen ve Wales Interactive tarafından yayımlanan bir FMV (Full motion video) oyunu. Basitçe türü açıklamak gerekirse siz seçimlerinizi yapıyorsunuz. Seçimlerinize göre hikayenin akışı değişiyor ve ona uygun olan video parçası oynuyor. 

Oyunda Londra'da gece vardiyasında çalışan bir otopark güvenliğini canlandırıyoruz. Bu güvenliğimizin başına gelenler, yaptığı başarılı veya başarısız soygunlar, belki bir aşk , belki bir kavga, belki bir ölüm hikayesi bizi oyunda bekliyor.Oyunun hikayesi o kadar çeşitli ki 7 farklı son yaratabilmişler ve herbirinden diğerine seçimlerinizle geçebiliyorsunuz. 

Grafik olarak baktığımızda FMV oyunları arasında gerçekten en üst sırada yer alıyor. Üstün video kalitesi gerçekten takdire şayan. Seslendirmeleri olağanüstü. Oyunda sadece İngilizce seslendirmeler ve Fransızca, İtalyanca, Almanca ve İngilizce altyazı seçenekleri mevcut. Oyunda kullanılan efektler, videolar arası geçişin muazzam akıcı olması, herhangi bir yerde takılma, loading ekranı olmadan oynama keyfi oyun zevkine zevk katıyor. 

Oynanışa baktığımızda sadece faremizle, karşımıza çıkan seçenekleri seçmek kalıyor bize. Macera oyunlarının sadece seçenekleri seçtiğiniz hali olarak düşünebilirsiniz. Oynanışta Esc tuşu ile videoyu durdurabiliyoruz. Sol tık ile karşımıza çıkan seçenekleri seçiyoruz. Burada seçeneklerden birini seçmemiz için bize çok kısa bir süre tanınıyor. Bu süre içerisinde seçemezseniz random pick yapıyor ve hikaye ona göre şekil alıyor.

Oyunda 20 adet başarım bulunuyor. Bunların hepsini alabilmek için oyundaki 7 sonu da görmek gerekiyor. 5.8 saat gibi bir sürede oyunun 7 farklı sonunu görebiliyorsunuz. Bir oyun aldığınızda 7 farklı hikaye birden almak gerçekten çok hoş bir duygu. Bazı bölümlerde abi bildiğin Pay Day 2 'nin film versiyonu diyorsun. Bazı yerlerde muazzam bir aksiyon filmi diyorsun. Bazı yerde yaptığın seçim seni yıkıyor, işkencelere uğratıyor.Bazı yerde mutlu sona ulaşıyorsun. Bu kadar çok öğeyi harmanlamak da bir ustalık istiyor ki oyuncular da yönetmen de bu işi çok iyi kotarmış.

Seçimler hakkında ipucu vermek gerekirse oyunda serserilerle kavga edip etmeyeceğinize karar verdiğiniz sahne ve çin restoranından çıktıktan sonraki seçim sahneleri sizin hangi sona gideceğinizi belirleyen seçimler. Ordan sonra yapacağımız seçimler de dallanıp budaklanıyor. (İnşallah spoiler olmamıştır )

Sonuç olarak olarak oyunun hikayesinin ve kalitesinin çok üst düzey olduğuna inanıyorum. Nerelere ne paralar vermiyoruz ki ? Çıkış fiyatı 21 TL, şu anki indirimli fiyatı 16,80 TL olan bu güzide oyunu almanızı tavsiye ediyorum. Özellikle bu türde bir oyunu ilk kez oynayacak arkadaşlar için türü sevdirecek nitelikte olduğuna inandığım bir oyun. Ama çıtayı çok yükselttiğinden diğer FMV oyunları sizde hayal kırıklıklarına neden olabilir. Aldığı paranın her kuruşunu sonuna kadar hakeden bu oyunu alın.

31279926.review:
Dieser interaktive Film hat eine spannende Story, gute Dialoge, hochwertige Bilder und passende Musikuntermalung, sowie ein viel zu selten anzutreffendes aber gutes Spielprinzip.
Die Entscheidungen, die man am Anfang trifft, wirken sich kaum auf den weiteren Spielverlauf aus, dafür spätere umso mehr.
Das hat den Vorteil, dass man zu Beginn nicht viel "falsch" machen kann, aber den Nachteil, dass die erste Spielhälfte beim erneuten Durchspielen langweilig wird. 
Teilweise schwachsinnige pseudo-kluge mathematische Gedanken des Protagonisten laden zum Fremdschämen ein.
Die drei Enden die ich bisher erlebt hatte haben sich durchaus voneinander unterschieden und haben mir gefallen,
aber noch mehr Enden will ich selber nicht erspielen aufgrund fehlender Vorspulfunktion.
Dafür ist mir meine Zeit zu schade, aber zum Glück gibt es ja Youtube. Da kann man dann vorspulen und sich die restlichen Enden bei Bedarf ansehen.
Generell kann man sich den Kauf sparen wenn man knapp bei Kasse ist und nicht unbedingt seine eigenen Entscheidungen treffen will.
In dem Fall einfach ein Walkthrough anschauen und damit immer noch einen unterhaltsamen Film erleben.

First things first.  The game is kinda short averaging just over an hour.  At least to get one of several endings.
It really feels like you are playing a movie.  Any of the actions that you take happen seamlessly and naturally and don't look at all like they were edited in instead feeling like it was actually a part of the show.  There is only one spot where I noticed that it felt like it was edited and that was during a confrontation with one of the characters where the sound would cut for just a second as the camera angle switched around.
There is a lot of production value put into this and it shows nothing looks fake as far as I can tell and the acting isn't too shabby.

Overall all it was a fun experiance and I am curious enough about some of my decisions to go back and see what may change.

31258545.review:
Was denn, der "Interactive Movie" ist zurück? In früheren Tagen war diese Art von Spiel sehr beliebt. Gefühlsmässig waren es wohl auch nur Tage, da der Hype so schnell vorbei war, wie Road Runner, wenn er an Wile E. Coyote vorbeiflitzt. Ich gebe zu, ich mochte die besseren Vertreter wie Tex Murphy und Gabriel Knight, sogar "Ripper" oder in Ansätzen "Phantasmagoria", da diese Games mehr waren, als nur interaktive Filme. 

Nun wagt sich also wieder ein Vertreter dieses Genres ans Tageslicht und definiert "Spiel" lediglich mit simplem und raschen Entscheiden aus zwei oder drei Antworten und dies alle paar Szenen. So legitim wie minimalistisch.

Die Story in "Late Shift" ist interessant und teilweise sogar richtig spannend. Die Schauspieler machen ihre Sache mehr als gut. Der Regisseur versteht sein Handwerk (was offen gesagt alles andere als selbstverständlich ist), die Kamerafahrten sind toll, Soundtrack ebenso. Die Tonabmischung funktioniert allerdings irgendwie nicht richtig und liess sich nicht einstellen. Sprich der Sound war immer wesentlich lauter, als die Stimmen der Figuren. Nervig.

Etwas schade ist, dass die Unterschiede in den Entscheidungen gross wirken und trotzdem zuweilen klein sind. Um dies zu erklären ein, nicht im Film enthaltenes Beispiel: Nehmen wir an, wir stehen am Morgen auf und gehen zur Arbeit. Der interaktive Film würde uns nun die Wahl lassen ob wir das Auto, den Bus oder den Zug nehmen. Am Ende landen wir aber so oder so bei der Arbeit. Sprich nicht alle, aber die meisten Entscheidungen führen uns an die Schauplätze, die wir ohnehin sehen würden. Weitere "Spiel"-Durchgänge offenbaren daher keine wirklich grossen Überraschungen oder neue Schauplätze. Kleine Ausnahmen bestätigen die Regel. Ein weiterer Start ist daher mehr ein abgrasen nach einer besseren Lösungen, um vielleicht einen der Charaktere zu retten (oder sich selbst).

Um beim oben genannten Beispiel zu bleiben; wenn ich statt dem Auto den Zug nehme, gerate ich nicht in den Stau, bin vielleicht schneller im Büro und erspare mir dadurch die Schelte vom Boss. Wenn ich aber den Bus nehme, sehe ich, dass dieser eine Affäre hat, was ich vielleicht gegen ihn einsetzen könnte. Wie auch immer, ich lande mit höchster Wahrscheinlichkeit im Büro und langweile mich dann über die Szenen, die ich bereits kenne. Womöglich hätten stärkere Unterschiede im Storyverlauf, zahlreichere Schauplätze, vielleicht sogar eine gänzlich andere Geschichte, meinen Gesamteindruck noch positiver werden lassen. 

Ist es nun fair, ein Titel wie diesen nicht wegen dem ersten Durchgang, sondern wegen den darauf folgenden zu kritisieren? Vielleicht nicht, aber hey... meine Entscheidung!

Ist das nun ein Spielfilm oder ein Filmspiel? Keine Ahnung, jedenfalls preislich durchaus fair und handwerklich mehr als ordentlich gemacht. Im ersten Durchgang packend und interessant. Die Auswahlmöglichkeiten bremsen den Film zu keiner Zeit, alles bleibt im Fluss. Zugreifen kann jeder dem klar ist, dass es nur ein Film mit Wahlmöglichkeiten ist und kein Spiel im eigentlichen Sinne. Interactive Movie par ex­cel­lence.

31249106.review:
Full Disclosure: I received a free copy of Late Shift to review for HookedGamers.com. Receiving a copy of this title did not in any way influence my opinion of it. 

The short version:
Late Shift is a unique experience that I probably wouldn’t have given much attention to had I seen it pop up on Steam or elsewhere, but I’m very glad that our paths did cross. The few issues that it does have are easily outweighed by what it does right, providing a compelling experience that engaged me, and has me wanting more. Both endings I experienced left me with a completely different opinion of the story’s purveying themes, and I fully expect to watch through the story at least a handful more times to see what else I can change. The cinematography, score, and acting quality are all top notch, surpassing my expectations. If a sequel were to be in the cards, I'd be first in line to watch.

9/10

31245170.review:
竟然在steam上看到了纯正的交互式电影！
作为交互式电影游戏的起源，想不到会以游戏的形式在游戏平台发售，心疼一秒。
[strike]G胖要骗钱卖电影了，钱包们快跑啊！[/strike]
[Spoiler]I always wanna watch some real interrative moives in theater,but they are hell of far away![/spoiler]
                                                                             微剧透评测
-剧情一般，虽然老套，但是套路永远是最稳的，总之就是英国屌丝被卷进一个大麻烦，然后泡妹子救妹子干boss的节奏。可惜不知道是经费的原因还是导演功力，环境跟豪车可以加分，但剧情推进跟重要冲突点简直儿戏，浓浓B级片的既视感。6/10及格
-选项大多还是有一定的意义，都有各自带来的影响（GTMD telltale）,选项的内容也能让人感到一定的纠结 。 [s]选择困难症的朋友们，来，这是你的刀[/s] 8/10优秀
-选择选项后的情景连接虽然不是完美，但也不违和，这是我认为交互式的电影或者游戏甚至RPG游戏最重要的一点，你不能随便来个神转折，对方的态度就神奇地转变了。（重点批评垃圾4）8/10优秀
-电影摄影技巧手法什么的我不懂，反正看着有电影的感觉，觉得还是挺满意的 [strike]10/10[/strike]
-演员演技虽然有点单一，但至少不是很浮夸，处于接受范围内 7/10及格
-难得的纯正交互式电影，上一次在steam上看到还是那个press x to not die，我肯定是兹次的。+1[spoiler]s[/spoiler]
总的可以给个8分，因为没有太多的横向比较，跟直到黎明这种受关注的大作比又感觉是欺负人，所以我认为作为一部交互电影，花33块RMB看一完整版蓝光CD肯定是合算的，毕竟单通一次就花了我一个小时，结局全通怎么也得四五个小时了吧。如果活在当初在电影里面看，所有观众投票决定选择，那像我这人品，最少得刷上几十次看能看完全结局。想想还是挺值的,还是推荐大家购买，尝尝鲜[spoiler]翻新？[/spoiler]也是蛮好的。

31245129.review:
So first up, I'm biased. I love FMV. I loved the old 'silliwood' games of the 90s and grew up reading Choose Your Own Adventure books, so this is everything I love about those genres.

I've played through twice with some drastically different decisions and the differences range from slight to massive. The differences upon conclusion were especially large. I'm actually getting excited thinking about how I'll change choices in my next run.

The game has excellent acting and production values and only a few places seem out of sync with the following scene, which is impressive considering where your choices can take you.

I lost interest in a certain collection of games lack of choice / consequence a while back, and this scratches that itch superbly.

For the price, even at full, this is solid entertainment with multiple re-run value.

31243874.review:
I had tons of fun watching this once and making choices. Then I asked my friend to do it while I watched and had even more fun as he ended up with the different outcome. Now I'm sure we're gonna ask someone else to do it as it will add up fun.

I think that it's a future of cinematography where people choose their own plotline. It doesn't even matter that it almost always goes sideways around a linear plotline. It gives you engagement in the storyline and you really care what happens on the screen with all the choices.

Of course replayability is different factor here as after you finished it once you see all the same sequences all the time and it might get boring if you are the only one replaying it, but if you throw couple of your friends in the action it gets even more fun as you share all the storylines with each other.

I really would like to see more of these movies in future.

31242864.review:
Not quite sure if I just watched a movie or played a game to be honest, the aftermath sensation is rather ambiguous.

Anyhow, this sure was truly thrilling and intriguing. The acting is really good, and at some points amazing. Sure there are moments where it shines through, but not in a way that it spoils the experience, but more the opposite.
The attention to details in acting, props and environment is top. It holds high image and is catchy right from start right through, the story holds depth and even so more taking the choices into consideration.

You will run this game several times, I did three runs right off the bat just to see the differences in some of the points. Which is where I find the only cons with this game/movie, it has no save/load function nor any skip function. So if you get at it again and go for another run, it will get quite repetitive fast. But then again, the amount of details in the environments and settings are more than enough to hold one occupied. I actually found several well hidden hints on my second and third run in the scenes which I had already passed through.

This sure was something completely different and I did truly enjoy it. I am usually not that much for movies or series, but this nails it, as it adds the parts which I miss in movies or series. The freedom of interaction into the narrative.
Sure, the lines may be a bit linear, and some may argue that some choices are 'pointless' as you end up in the same parts anyhow, maybe just slight different. But considering that this is live action with real actors, one must really admire the amount of work put into this; as with any game.

I am happy I tried this one out, it really deviated from what I am used to in terms of gaming, and really added something new to my overall gaming experience.
And I do recommend this to anyone who enjoys a great story, especially in movies or series but with added game mechanics.

31241696.review:
如果让我只用一个词来形容这部电影式游戏的话，我想我会用上“艺术品”这个的词。

也许你会觉得我的措辞略显夸张，但是作为一个电影电视游戏俱有涉及的文艺宅而言，我从这部半游戏半电影的《Late Shift》身上看到了一种可能成为主流电影?/游戏?的呈现方式。而当我在脑子里模拟那种可能出现的体验的时候，是无比兴奋和投入的。

享受游戏和享受电影电视音乐那些被动娱乐方式最大的不同，是玩家的主观能动性。在善与恶两种截然相反的选择面前，玩家可以自主的替控制的角色做出不同的选择。

而享受电影电视甚至音乐，从来都是一种被动的过程。观影者无法替剧中的角色做出选择，无法在主角即将做出“错误”决定之时阻止那一切的发生，只能眼睁睁看着导演和编剧们操纵着主角陷入各种愚蠢和悲惨的境地之中。如果我没有记错，历史上曾经有一部美剧的导演试图用多种结局的方式来让观众参与剧情讨论和影响剧情发展，可惜那部剧集因为太没有严格的逻辑而被观众诟病。而那部不太出名又同时被另外一部同样以开放式剧情出名的美剧（《LOST》）夺走绝大多数光芒的的美剧，叫《Harper's Island》。为什么我会联想到这两部美剧，特别是少有人知而且被普遍诟病编剧脑残的《Harper's Island》？请容我慢慢道来。

《Harper's Island》的故事很有阿加莎的《无人生还》的味道，一群人来到小岛上参加婚礼，然后一个接一个被发现死亡，凶手就隐藏在余下的宾客和主人中间，似乎每个人都有去做杀手的可能，因为每个人的背景故事里，都有促使他们成为凶手可能的故事线索。况且，那些死掉的人里面，是否真的已经被害?还只是为了掩盖自己是杀手的本质而营造出来被害的假象？看看剧情宣传的口号：“13个星期（13集），25个嫌疑人，1个凶手”。

我记得在剧情还在连载期间看过一些剧中主角的采访，从那些只言片语的碎片细节里推论出一个非常有趣的细节，导演给剧中绝大多数主角都拍了不止一种剧情，导演有信心从已经拍摄完毕的片段里剪切出完全不同的25种结局，因为他为这25种不同结局拍摄了25种不同的逻辑片段。

就如同这部《Late Shift》所展现的方式一样！完整7种不同结局所需要的不同素材片段都已经准备好了，玩家想要实现所有七种，就必须静下心来思考，去斟酌每个决定背后可能引出的后续，去思考玩家替主角做出的决定最终可能引向那种状况，那些决定对主角，对主角有关系的周围的人，是好还是坏。

玩家在做出不同的选择以后，基于玩家的选择，从而决定下面的剧情。这在游戏玩家看来无比熟悉和普通的方式，如果想要通过电视或者电影来实现，不管是《Harper's Island》所在的2009年，还是到了8年后的今天，都是一件非常不容易的事。

《Harper's Island》的导演希望通过前面的剧情引起观众的广泛讨论，在观众的讨论进行到最高点的时候，抛出与绝大多数观众观点不同的结局来造成戏剧化。为了达到这种效果，为了让开放式结局的逻辑完整，导演不能给出太多的细节，因为给出任何一个关键细节剧情就会扼杀掉好几种可能的结局，因为逻辑上无法自圆其说。正是因为要达到那样震撼的效果，《Harper's Island》的导演和电视台进行了一场豪赌，赌观众会买他们的账，会让剧情进行广泛的讨论过程，好让他们有在讨论进行到最剧烈的时候抛出那个让绝大多数人都想不到的结局，就像绝大多数人第一次看到《无人生还》的结局时那种震撼和冲击。

可惜，《Harper's Island》因为要隐藏的细节太多，而保持观众兴趣的内容又透露得太少，所以剧情还没进入“剧烈讨论剧情”的时刻已经被收收视率失去信心的电视台枪毙了，导演也因此失去了热情从而让剧情草草结尾。但是导演的思想我觉得不会那么轻易就被丢弃，就像今天我重试了三次《Late Shift》的剧情一样，也许这就是这种开放式电影/参与式电影/主动式电影可能实现的方式。

一个人玩游戏，做出各种不同的选择可以称之为探索。
如果是两个人一起玩，一起讨论做出决定呢？如果两个人不够，三个？更多个？我想每加入一个人参与决策，那最终得到的结果都会截然不同，甚至同一批人对剧情的再次探索都会因为对细节了解得更多而得出完全不同的决定从而产生截然不同的新的结局，从而让再一次的探索成为新的可能。这样的探索，或者说这样的情景出现在我对未来电影，电视和游戏充满了期待。

可以假象一下，在电影院看电影时每个人手里都有一个选择器通过投票数从而决定主角的决策和最终电影结局的方式，那种沉浸式和开放式的参与体验，会不会就是下一代主流娱乐方式的雏形呢？如果这种情况未来真的发生了，那么我对本作的评价“艺术品”，就实至名归了。

诚然，除去这种可能发生在未来的风潮，本作的本身其实也有一个很大的热点。就是标题中的 “Shift”。玩家可能会一直扮演“好人”，无论已经进入了哪种结局当中，玩家都试图做一些符合普遍社会道德准则的决定。但是，如果玩家试图扭转坏局面，通过已经获得的信息去改变剧情的时候，“Shift”就发生了，因为这时玩家会做出一些违背普遍社会道德准则的决定。就像本作的主角一样，他可能一开始就选择了自私，一路厚黑到底。也可能从一个无私地习惯帮助别人的好人被现实活生生步步相逼，从而走上了绝路。到底是在哪一瞬间发生的变化？那个时间，就是那个Shift Point。

在那一刻，玩家和游戏的主角，都是被生活和导演折磨着做出改变（Shift）同病相怜的可怜虫。The Shift，never too late.

31241016.review:
TL;DR:
Late Shift is the best FMV adventure game in production so far, and perhaps the most costly in making. If you enjoy FMV games or Choose-your-own adventure games, give it a try.
Pros:
+Great performing
+Very cinematically professional production
+Engaging story
+Wow, your choice actually matters in this game
Con:
-No fast forward or chapter selection making revisiting rather a chore

A fine FMV game that's become rather a rarity these days. We do get stuff like Contradiction, upcoming The Infectious Madness of Doctor Dekker, a Tex Murphy reboot titled Tesla Effect, and Her Story, a piece of real innovative narrative, but I wouldn't go ahead and call FMV ADV genre rejuvenating -- it's as dead as my late grandpa, may him rest in peace, for its high production cost and relatively low gameplay value.

And I do look fondly at FMV cutscenes, for it's wonky, it's cheap, its small-budget-ish look and lack of professional cinematic techniques. I may be fooling myself, but these qualities actually give me a sense of passion and love.

That being said, Late Shift, to my surprise, hasn't had any of them. It's a glorious, triumphant masterpiece among its fellows with the best production I have ever seen. The performing in Late Shift is great and highly convincing; it's very cinematically professionally filmed -- the closest to a modern film, I dare say -- and its story not half bad, engaging and intriguing. Hence, as soon as I got my hands on the game, I was utterly surprised by it.

The gameplay is the kind of "choose-your-own" adventure that has been popular lately (e.g. Telltale Games titles, Knee Deep, D4)... but with actually important choices that can lead to up to seven different endings and many different sequences, unlike that notorious pop-up message saying "Don Trump will remember that" without any noticeable impact on the ending. Thus although the game is short per playthrough (around 80 minutes), it's worth multiple revisits, just to see how where that butterfly would cast a storm upon.

So Late Shift is a great FMV game, perhaps the best so far.

But it cannot revive the genre, sadly no. For what it's worth, I'd say it will have a problem breaking even: it's just simply way too expensive, for the genre to follow up, and for it, as a game in a dead genre, to recover its cost. Unlike Matt, I'm not good at numbers, I can't figure out how much does it cost to feature approx three to six hours in total of professional movie clips, and how many copies must be sold to start making profits. 

One minor issue does bug me though: you are not allowed to fast forward or chapter selection, making revisiting a chore, rather than an enjoyable journey. After three playthroughs I think I have now memorized most of the lines from the intro sequence.

I'm sorry to say so but its gameplay is just not appealing enough to modern gamers. In that sense, it's both exceeding and lagging behind, the former its exquisite production and the latter its genre. I do love Late Shift, but I can only recommend it to those who like FMV games and Choose-your-own adventures.

31240270.review:
A fairly solid interactive Choose-Your-Own-Adventure movie where you play a part in a heist and then have to deal with the repercussions.  The video and audio quality are solid, and the quick (but plentiful) decisions are handled smoothly and without affecting the pace.  The acting was fine.

In my single playthrough that lasted roughly 75 minutes, there were 59 (out of a total of 180+) decisions and I saw 12 of the 14 scenes available.   Though I assume that the same scene can have a different flavor based on your decisions - in the trailer, someone is holding a girl at gun point in a car park, whereas in my playthrough, the girl had already left, and I was the one being held at gun point.  But I would guess that the same basic plot with a few significant alternatives, with many of the decisions branching back to the main path.  Some of the decisions I made early on, though, did have a role in events later in the game.

The playthrough I had was satisfactory but didn't have a happy ending.  The game advertises seven endings, but I don't know if these all occur at the end of the game, or if maybe one or more occur earlier in the game.  

My guess is that you would probably need 2-3 playthroughs to see the vast majority of the game, and maybe there would be incentive enough to go through all 7 endings, although the amount of new stuff you would see would probably have gone down a lot.

Also, I played all in one sitting - I'm not sure if there was a savegame if you left in the middle, but there certainly wasn't an option I saw to save multiple savegames.  Which means if you want to play a similar game but wanted to change your decisions midgame or towards the end, you would have to replay the entire game.  That's the one negative I have about this game.

31230860.review:
This is one of those reviews that makes it feel like steam needs a "Neutral" setting. The movie is shot well and the acting/atmosphere is convincing. If you want to see an hour long thriller mini-movie then you could do worse than Late Shift. It has some clever ideas that make it worth checking out. 

The main selling point, that this is an interactive movie, unfortunately falls short. After your first playthrough you will inevitably have the "I wonder what would happen if I just did this" feeling. If, like I did, you decide to start up the game again and choose all the different choices, you will generally be treated to a different 15 seconds of movie that then corrects to put you back on track with the main narrative. Each scene is maybe around 5 minutes, with the total game having around 14 scenes. On your first playthrough, you'll probably get through around 12, meaning there isn't actually much replay value here. It is true that there are several different endings, and that is pretty cool, but each ending scene is probably about a minute, which is unsatisfying if you just restarted the whole movie to see what the different choices did.

Late shift is interesting and well executed, but I wouldn't pay more than 5 dollars for it. That said, maybe you have an itch and want a unique way to spend your next 60-90 minutes. Just know that after the first playthrough, there isn't too much more to see.

31230683.review:
late shift的第一个中文测评，希望不是最后一个。首先提一下因为这个游戏不支持中文，所以玩的话需要有点英语基础。

late shift就是边看电影边对演员的行为做出决定，所以与其说是游戏不如说是交互式电影。游戏给我的体验更像是玩家本身就是导演，可以选一些作为观众感觉很没有逻辑的选项，就因为这样我还从新开了一次。

演员的演技感觉还是可圈可点的，这方面不是很想交代太多，感觉说多了容易剧透。不过总的来说late shift的结局一共有7种不同的结局和14个不同的chapter。可以玩的很作死，也可以玩的很苟，当然某些不经意的选择就会reveal another chapter。


也许有人会觉得late shift不像暴雨那样操纵角色探索线索，但游戏的本质确实有所不同，一概而论的对比也是不可取的。如果你想看一部多结局的电影，那么不管是原价还是打折都是可以入手的。当然细思极恐的一点就是，当你通关第一遍之后，想去探索更多的剧情的时候，你就要做一些重复的选择，可能会比较枯燥直到你玩到你想要的结局为止.

31229186.review:
Late Shift is, first and foremost, a FMV game. I've only ever played one other FMV game myself, Contradiction, but I've seen others in videos and from the views of friends etc. From what I can gather this game plays extremely smoothley in comparison, the vast majority of the time I felt as if I was watching a movie except when I had to frantically scramble to the the mouse to make a decision.

The game is a decision-based thriller much like the famous Telltale games, however it usually has 2 decisions that tend to be 1 decision based on a passionate, spur-of-the-moment type personality where as the other will be a much more conservative, self-preservation, rational view. For some it might seem simplistic, I sure did, but it makes it much more intresting when you get to big, life or death situations that force you into these mindsets. All decisions have quite a rapid countdown that had me picking a choice I wasn't always happy with - in the end this was much more immersive as the character we play as, Matt, would only have these few seconds to make a choice such as the ones we make in the game. I found that unlike many choice-based games they definately seemed to take serious infleuence especially at the end of my first run, it all sort of came together like a perfect jigsaw puzzle. I so far have only made one run of the game but I'll definately be getting those other 6 endings (7 total). If any ammendments to this review need to be made I'll leave them in the Edit section I'll have at the bottom.

The story itself was fantastic, like a good book, multiple things are pieced together by the end and your choices seem to definately have an effect. It takes the story of Matt, all we get unfortunately, a young student in London. During a late night shift at a, seemingly, valet agency his life is flipped upside down and he is thrown into a high stakes crime-heist story of survival in a world you know nothing about. It had be gripped early on and constantly was considering if my decisions were the right thing, what I would've actually done and their associated consequences with the law and other after-affects.

Must say that I am not at all educated in acting but I felt convinced but quite a few characters with some being slightly goofy but I imagine that was their personalities. I felt that maybe the main character was a little too rapidly progressing in his character development but it was only a minimal gripe, probably more deserving to be in the segment about the story rather than the acting but whatever. The casting seemed solid and that's really all I'm comfortable to say about the acting.

To top it all off I think this game is so far, fantastic. My conclusion on the first run was amazing and I genuinely surprised on the twist it threw at me. I'd definatley give this a shot, especially if you're already on the fence, due to this I'm gonna go look up some more FMV's that could be a lot of fun.

31228831.review:
Late Shift is extremely well written and it's backed up by a high production value and a talented cast.
Shot in full HD with a really atmospheric soundtrack.

The choices you make definitely do make siginificant altertations to the whole story and what ending you get.
The game itself is very short if you plan on only playing it once, but if you're only going to play it once then this really isn't the game for you as its clearly meant to be played several times so that you get the ending you desire.

There is really good atmosphere in Late Shift that really helps you get into the story, and the fact that you shape the path the story takes really helps you get more invested in it than just watching a movie

I only really have a couple of complaints, mainly with audio. I really like the score but it's really too loud at points, for example when the protaganist is inner mono-logging  it is very difficult to make out what he says with the score being so loud. Theres no audio slider for just the music so I found myself turning on subitles for just these scenes to hear what he's thinking.
Speaking of subtitles I would have liked a subtitle option for just the foreign spoken parts.

Overall it's definitely an experience worth €10 and I'll definitely be getting CtrlMovie's next project.

31227197.review: Consiglio fortemente l'acquisto a chi è avvezzo a questo tipo di "giochi". Late Shift è un mediometraggio basato esclusivamente su scelte che saremo noi videogiocatori a fare e, a differenza di molti altri titoli ben più noti, qui incideranno sul serio e anche tanto. Io per ora ho scoperto solo due dei sette finali possibili e l'avventura da me giocata era completamente differente, praticamente quasi nulla uguale alla prima. La recitazione è a livelli buoni, se non ottimi e l'adrenalina non manca. Unica pecca è la longevità; una run si finisce tranquillamente in 40-45 minuti, ma si può tralasciare considerando che saremo "costretti" a rigiocarlo più e più volte se si vogliono scoprire tutti i finali possibili. Finalmente una piacevole ventata d'aria fresca nel genere FMV, spesso sottovalutato dal videogiocatore medio. Consiglio come già detto, l'acquisto..anche a prezzo pieno sia perché non è eccessivo per chi ama il genere, sia perché merita davvero. Sono rimasto molto colpito da questo titolo.

31226987.review:
I'm thoroughly impressed.

Late Shift is an evolution from the old storytelling method of Interactive Fiction, which we are seeing becoming more popular through the work of Choice of Games, Tin Man Games, and to a certain degree even Telltale. However, I have never before seen the genre applied to film in such a coherent and well-formed fashion.

While I've only played through it once, I am definitely hooked and intend to play it several times more. The achievements are promising seven different endings? I intend to find them all sooner or later. The length is comparable to short films or episodes of TV miniseries, with roughly equivalent production value. On occasion you see that there is a clear cut based on your choices so far, but while noticeable it - at least to me - ended up looking much more like a signpost telling me where the other content hides than an issue. In many ways I was expecting much harsher cuts before I started playing since I know how hard it can be to meld things together in a seamless way from my own Interactive Fiction writing.

The story is a classic caper from the heist [spoiler]to the double-cross to the triple-cross[/spoiler], but due to the way you have control of the story, you become much more invested in what is happening than if you were watching something like Ocean's Eleven on your screen instead.
The main characters do a good job acting-wise. Some, such as Haruka Abe who plays May-Ling, shine brighter than others. To be honest the biggest problem I had was with the characterization of Matt, played by Jow Sowerbutts, who comes off almost as bipolar. I understand that is due to the way the interactivity system binds scenes together, leading to what seem like sudden mood-swings that don't reflect the way I would imagine my choices to steer the main character, but that's a problem of the audiovisual medium we're playing with here.

Overall I definitely recommed Late Shift as a worthy experience to go through. If you dislike it, a single play-through won't last long enough for you to return it afterwards in case you did not enjoy it at all, but I would certainly recommend this to anyone and everyone - both those who are unfamiliar with interactive fiction and those who have been into the scene since the early 80s.
If nothing else, sit down and get Late Shift to see what can be done when film and gameplay meet in a true cinematic experience instead of whatever the AAA game companies are trying to shove our way.

31224665.review:
As I didn't even know anyone made FMV games anymore and the ones back in the day were more full motion pixelation I thought I'd give it a try and I'm glad I did.

I've only made it through one storyline so far and it's prob. the worst ending - that's the way I roll baby :P - and I liked more or less everything about it, the pro's:
Not too long between choices so I didn't feel like I was more or less only watching a movie.
The acting was more than good enough generally speaking. (some little "off moment" only)
The cars in the garage... (you have to be a petrol head for that but if you are you'll love that BMW... :) )
Settings were well made, that slightly "Sleeping dogs" look of the restaurant was very fitting.

Cons:
The music did have a tendency to get a tad too loud covering the narration at a couple of places, this may be my headset of course but I don't think it is. (it did not happen often but I found it very noticeable when it did, it should in no way put you off buying it though, it's a bit "nitpicky")
No subtitling of the Cantonese/Chinese, whatever it was, it's quite easy to guesstimate the essence of what was said, would've been nice with a translation though, again a bit "nitpicky". (as it only concerns a few sentences it does in now way hinder the overall experience)

I'll without a doubt play more of this to see some other things happen...and maybe, if I'm lucky I'll get to see some good end too....if there is one...

31222342.review:
Late Shift лучше попробовать самому, чем читать отзывы.
Просто потому, что это кино, а не игра. Чтобы понять что это за продукт - гляньте трейлер, он весьма исчерпывающий. 

От себя добавлю, что в кино я разбираюсь сильно хуже, чем в играх. Но первые 30 минут точно сей фильм держал меня в напряжении. Прежде всего потому, что сохранялась иллюзия некого выбора, мол, от меня в самом деле что-то зависит. Появлялось ощущение участия в картине. И где-то в середине это ощущение напрочь пропадало и вторая половина фильма оставила сильно меньше эмоций и впечатлений.

Но мне, как неискушенному зрителю, очень понравилось.

31219922.review:
[h1] Давай поиграем в кино [/h1]

Довольно-таки интересный продукт в игродеве (если это вообще соотносится к этому сегменту)
По большому счёту это фильм, где вы сами выбираете как пойдёт сюжет для главного героя, соответственно от вас же и зависит финальный результат.
Система выбора напоминает Heavy Rain/Until Dawn/The Walking Dead. Довольно просто сориентироваться, плюсом к выборам идёт временная шкала, которая по истечении времени, выберет наиболее оптимальный по мнению создателей вариант. Всё просто, как салат.

[h1] Я уеду жить в Лондон [/h1]

Все действия игры (фильма) происходит в том самом Лондоне, откуда вылезло довольно много известных личностей, живых и выдуманных. Антураж британской столицы передан превосходно, даже черные кэбы, как обязательный атрибут Лондона, попали в кадр.

Зачатки сюжета начинаются просто: вы студент, подрабатывающий сторожем на парковке для состоятельных граждан. И оттуда стартует  приключение, которое будет либо скучным, либо захватывающим, либо вовсе мрачным и патетичным.

В игре всего 7 концовок, но обзор писался в момент, когда я прошел только на одну из них. Даже после финала, невозможно догадаться, что включают в себя другие концовки (хотя я вру, парочку еще можно высосать из пальца).

[h1] Я не чувствую русского! У тебя его нет.	[/h1]

Увы, но русский язык по понятным причинам не завезли, поэтому пока приходится играть на оригинале.
Но зато где, как не здесь можно насладиться таким добротным британским английским?
Среднего уровня вполне достаточно для понимания 75% текста по моим измерениям.

В конечном итоге, рекомендую игру всем, так как это очень добротная вещь, да и можно на большом экране под пивчик или чё ты там любишь, провести за ней часок другой да и цена божеская.
